instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: Wasted 820 2936 on red wine
threads.message:
First board over with this extent of corrosion

corroded components
<CAPACITOR>C6960</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C6950</CAPACITOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> <CAPACITOR>C7040</CAPACITOR> f7040 <CAPACITOR>C7030</CAPACITOR> <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> 

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> up down right piss components

j6955 gone

<CHIP>U6500</CHIP> gone 

<CHIP>U6700</CHIP> gone

<CHIP>U6880</CHIP> gone

components from l9701 to <CAPACITOR>C7513</CAPACITOR> corroded green

bulg between L7030  j6702

Where should I start  (labbit hole)

will post pics after ultrasonic cleaning

threads.title: Wasted 820 2936 on red wine
threads.message: this will be a nightmare. first fix obvious corrosion damage replacing the broken looking shit, then begin troubleshooting journey when components no longer look broken and traces are back to how they should be. but this will be a huge waste of time.

threads.title: Wasted 820 2936 on red wine
threads.message: If there is a bulge in the board I would recommend starting by throwing it in the scrap bin.
